post.summary:
CancelInvoice cancels a currently open invoice. If the invoice is already
canceled, this call will succeed. If the invoice is already settled, it will
fail.

AddHoldInvoice creates a hold invoice. It ties the invoice to the hash
supplied in the request.

SettleInvoice settles an accepted invoice. If the invoice is already
settled, this call will succeed.

get.summary:
SubscribeSingleInvoice returns a uni-directional stream (server -> client)
to notify the client of state transitions of the specified invoice.
Initially the current invoice state is always sent out.

A bare-bones invoice for a payment within the Lightning Network.  With the
details of the invoice, the sender has all the data necessary to send a
payment to the recipient.

Externally discovered pre-image that should be used to settle the hold
invoice.

node_id.description: The public key of the node at the start of the channel.

chan_id.description: The unique identifier of the channel.

fee_base_msat.description: The base fee of the channel denominated in millisatoshis.

fee_proportional_millionths.description:
The fee rate of the channel for sending one satoshi across it denominated in
millionths of a satoshi.

cltv_expiry_delta.description: The time-lock delta of the channel.

memo.description:
An optional memo to attach along with the invoice. Used for record keeping
purposes for the invoice's creator, and will also be set in the description

r_preimage.description:
The hex-encoded preimage (32 byte) which will allow settling an incoming
HTLC payable to this preimage. When using REST, this field must be encoded
as base64.

r_hash.description:
The hash of the preimage. When using REST, this field must be encoded as
base64.

add_index.description:
The "add" index of this invoice. Each newly created invoice will increment
this index making it monotonically increasing. Callers to the
SubscribeInvoices call can use this to instantly get notified of all added
invoices with an add_index greater than this one.

settle_index.description:
The "settle" index of this invoice. Each newly settled invoice will
increment this index making it monotonically increasing. Callers to the
SubscribeInvoices call can use this to instantly get notified of all
settled invoices with an settle_index greater than this one.

amt_paid_sat.description:
The amount that was accepted for this invoice, in satoshis. This will ONLY
be set if this invoice has been settled. We provide this field as if the
invoice was created with a zero value, then we need to record what amount
was ultimately accepted. Additionally, it's possible that the sender paid
MORE that was specified in the original invoice. So we'll record that here
as well.

amt_paid_msat.description:
The amount that was accepted for this invoice, in millisatoshis. This will
ONLY be set if this invoice has been settled. We provide this field as if
the invoice was created with a zero value, then we need to record what
amount was ultimately accepted. Additionally, it's possible that the sender
paid MORE that was specified in the original invoice. So we'll record that
here as well.

state.description: The state the invoice is in.

htlcs.description: List of HTLCs paying to this invoice [EXPERIMENTAL].

features.description: List of features advertised on the invoice.

is_keysend.description:
Indicates if this invoice was a spontaneous payment that arrived via keysend

chan_id.description: Short channel id over which the htlc was received.

htlc_index.description: Index identifying the htlc on the channel.

amt_msat.description: The amount of the htlc in msat.

accept_height.description: Block height at which this htlc was accepted.

accept_time.description: Time at which this htlc was accepted.

resolve_time.description: Time at which this htlc was settled or canceled.

expiry_height.description: Block height at which this htlc expires.

state.description: Current state the htlc is in.

mpp_total_amt_msat.description: The total amount of the mpp payment in msat.
